note: Patient presented with persistent cough and shortness of breath. After a series of tests, including a chest X-ray, the patient was diagnosed with pneumonia.

Patient experienced sudden chest pain and difficulty breathing. An ECG and blood tests led to a diagnosis of myocardial infarction.
Excessive thirst, frequent urination, and unexplained weight loss were key symptoms leading to a diagnosis of diabetes Type 1.
Chronic fatigue and muscle weakness, coupled with skin darkening, resulted in a diagnosis of Addison's disease after blood tests indicated low cortisol levels.
Patient reported severe abdominal pain and bloody stools. A colonoscopy revealed inflammation and ulcers, leading to a diagnosis of ulcerative colitis.
Recurring episodes of extreme anxiety, heart palpitations, and excessive sweating led to a diagnosis of pheochromocytoma after blood tests and imaging studies.
Patient complained of blurred vision and seeing 'halos' around lights. An eye examination indicating increased pressure led to a diagnosis of glaucoma.
Experiencing tremors, slowed movement, and balance issues, the patient was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease after a neurological examination.
Severe back pain, especially after lifting a heavy object, led to a diagnosis of herniated disc following an MRI of the spine.
